citation.abstract: L-Lactic acid was the major component in material isolated from humans that was active as an attractant for female yellow fever mosquitoes, Aedes aegypti (L.). The L(+)-isomer was several times as attractive as the D-isomer. Good correlation was found between the attractiveness of an individual to mosquitoes and the quantity of lactic acid present in an acetone washing of his hand.
citation.publisher: American Association for the Advancement of Science
citation.title: L-Lactic Acid: A Mosquito Attractant Isolated from Humans

news.summary: En ninguna cena de verano faltan unos comensales que nunca son invitados, pero que se ceban a costa de los demás. Y si en nuestras latitudes los mosquitos no pasan de ser intrusos molestos, en climas tropicales son una preocupación mucho mayor por las múlt

news.title: Por qué todos los mosquitos me pican a mí
news.summary: Con la llegada del calor reaparecen en nuestras vidas los mosquitos. Pequeños insectos que no solo son molestos, sino que transmiten peligrosas enfermedades como el zika, el dengue, la chikungunya y la malaria.
